Discuss the pros and cons of the Indian Government’s action plan for demonetization of Rs. 1,000 and Rs. 500 currency notes. What would be the long term impact of this step on terror financing and creation of unaccounted wealth?

 

 ON November 8th 2016, the Indian Government announced the drastic and unimaginable step taken by the ministry of Finance to put an end to the black money circulation by demonetization of the Rs.1000 and Rs.500 currency notes. This step will not only put an end to corruption and bribery but strangle to death the cash economy which is in black. By this step the goverment pulls back Rs.14,95,000/-crores in the demonetised currecy . This move had defienitely pinched the common man while our Honourable  Prime minister , Mr. Narendra Modi Ji , has tried to hit people with black money real hard !!

There have been casualities and death of the so many patients, young and old across the nation as hospitals have refused to accept the demonetised currency of treatment. We have also been reading in the newspapers and social media articles on how various businesses and markets have been hit by this action at the central level. Small time vendors who have been stocking supplies and bussinesses like the tender coconut market has come to a stand- still because of a svere cash crunch across states.Wedding and other auspicious occasions were cancelled or called off hurting the sentiments of the middle class strata in the country. However, as these are the few hurdles we are facing due to the startling announcement from the centre, the long term impact of  this significant initiative would undoubtedly choke anti-social activities like terror financing, creation of unaccounted wealth and money laundering in the Indian exconomy. Let us all support this move and cooperate in the current state of a nantional exigency untill the end of December 2016. Jai hind !!

The Smart Elevetor Market

 

The rising numbers of high rise residential complexes and commercial spaces has significantly increased the deployment of smart elevetors across the glode. With US, UK . Canada and France being the leaders in implementing the mordern version of the conventional elevator sysytems , they have saved on manpower , time a and revenues considerably .The global markets for smart elevetors is expected to experience a significant growth and the market is expected to experice a radical shift by 2020.Technologically advanced features and integration of intelligent communication, access control and security technology enables smart elevators to cater to the custom needs of various end-use segments such as residential, commercial, healthcare, industrial and hospitality among many others. Smart elevators can be customized to the unique requirements of each of these end-user segments and can provide excellent reliability, hygiene, aesthetics, ride and destination control, space, and comfort.

 

The smart Technology

With the technology advancing year by year , the conventional elevetor systems are udergoing the make over and are more techologically advanced today.

Elevators consume large amount of energy in large commercial buildings where there is more inter-floor traffic of people. Therefore, giant players in the market are innovating solutions that would consume less power and provide same customer experience, i.e. Smart Elevators.For instance, Mitsubishi has developed a multi-elevator smart technology in 2011 that reduces energy consumption approximately up to 10%. The smart technology focuses on operational efficiency during peak hours of rush and on the other hand maximizes energy reduction during lull times.

Global vendors of vertical transportation systems are currently shifting their focus to smart elevators to remain competitive. ThyssenKrupp, which maintains and manages more than 1.1 million elevators, has now integrated cloud capabilities to its systems in order to gather valuable data about systems and sensors as well as improve its maintenance service. In 2014, Schindler Elevator Corporation successfully completed the installation and modernization of its PORT elevator technology at the Union Plaza office building, Puerto Rico. The Hearst Tower and the Bank of America in Manhattan, the Humana headquarters in Louisville and the Crescent in Dallas are some of the buildings where Schindler Corporation has installed its smart elevator destination dispatch technology system.

 Commercial application 

 The commercial application of these sysytems would be a boon for the market growth across segments like, offices, hotel & lodgings, healthcare, financial institutions and retail (malls and multiplexes). 

The capacity and the passenger capacity of these systems varies depending on the sectors they are used. For example, residential buildings have lesser inter floor traffic as compared to commercial buildings; therefore, the capacity and the passenger capacity varies; whereas, in healthcare sector, hospitals require deeper elevators to take stretchers. In malls and multiplexes, vandal proof material of smart elevator is required. In addition to this, spacious and ride comfort elevators are essential in retail and warehouses. Therefore, the elevators are designed according to the purpose of the elevator.

Smart Elevator Market

The global smart elevator market is expected to grow significantly. Driven by modernization of existing elevator systems, the market is expected to experience a radical shift by 2020. With a considerable number of new deployment anticipated in developing Asian countries, the deployments of smart elevators could potentially takeover modernization revenue by 2020. China alone accounts for roughly 53 percent of the upcoming high-rise projects around the world.

Globally, the rising number of high-rise buildings has escalated the demand for a fast, comfortable, efficient, and secure vertical transportation system. In addition, worldwide green infrastructure standards and statutory requirements are instrumental in compelling deployment of smart elevators in new structures and current infrastructures.

The modernization of conventional elevator systems in developed countries such as U.S., UK, Canada, and France has been a major contributor to smart elevator market revenue so far. However, over the period, upcoming high-rise buildings would adopt fresh deployment of smart elevator systems.
